hr.fer.oop.lab6.prob2

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.oop.lab6.prob2.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements board for Conway's Game of Life. It has array of booleans. If cell state is true it means that cell is alive, otherwise is dead. Every cell interacts with its eight neighbours, which are the cells that are horizontally, vertically, or diagonally adjacent. At each step in time, the following transitions occur: Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by underpopulation. Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation. Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by overpopulation. Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction. There is no and of board.It is connected over corners.
    Author:
    Jurij Kos

      • countAliveNeighbours

        public int countAliveNeighbours(int x,
                                int y)
        Neighbours are cells that are horizontally, vertically, or diagonally adjacent. Every cell has eight neighbours.
        Returns:

      • playOneIteration

        public void playOneIteration()
        This method makes one iteration through the game and updates all cells. After that it triggers all listeners.
